metadata.Title: CVE-2014-7300 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - low.
metadata.Description:
GNOME Shell 3.14.x before 3.14.1, when the Screen Lock feature is used, does not limit the aggregate memory consumption of all active PrtSc requests, which allows physically proximate attackers to execute arbitrary commands on an unattended workstation by making many PrtSc requests and leveraging a temporary lock outage, and the resulting temporary shell availability, caused by the Linux kernel OOM killer.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-7300` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

gnome-shell - 3.24.2-0ubuntu6
gnome-shell-common - 3.24.2-0ubuntu6
No subscription required

criterions.comment: gnome-shell package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.24.2-0ubuntu6').
